summary: This bill, the Striking and Locked Out Workers Healthcare Protection Act, aims to prevent employers from terminating or altering the health insurance coverage of employees during lockouts or lawful strikes. It amends the National Labor Relations Act to include such actions as unfair labor practices, specifying civil penalties for violations. Penalties range from $50,000 to $150,000, with potential director/officer liability and factors for penalty determination. The bill also defines "group health plan".
